#summary Serializations of OpenHandle

== OpenHandle Serializations ==

The OpenHandle service currently serializes Handle records as:

 * [OpenHandleSerializationRdf RDF/XML]
 * [OpenHandleSerializationN3 RDF/N3]
 * [OpenHandleSerializationJson RDF/JSON]

Initial serializations include the following:

 * [http://www.w3.org/TR/rdf-syntax-grammar/ RDF/XML]
  ** Standard XML-based serialization for RDF ([http://code.google.com/p/openhandle/wiki/OpenHandleSerializationRdf wiki page], [http://nascent.nature.com/openhandle/handle?id=4263537/4069&format=rdf&mimetype=application/xml example])
 *  [http://www.w3.org/TeamSubmission/n3/ RDF/N3]
  ** Notation3, a text-based serialization of RDF ([http://code.google.com/p/openhandle/wiki/OpenHandleSerializationN3 wiki page], [http://nascent.nature.com/openhandle/handle?id=4263537/4069&format=n3&mimetype=text/plain  example])
 * [http://www.json.org/ JSON]
  ** Java**Script Object Notation ([http://code.google.com/p/openhandle/wiki/OpenHandleSerializationJson wiki page], [http://nascent.nature.com/openhandle/handle?id=4263537/4069&format=json&mimetype=text/plain example])

A candidate serialization format would be [http://www.w3.org/TR/rdf-sparql-query/ SPARQL] Query Results: [http://www.w3.org/TR/rdf-sparql-XMLres/ XML Format] and/or [http://www.w3.org/TR/rdf-sparql-json-res/ JSON].

Each serialization can also occur in two forms - see OpenHandleCompactForms:

 * Full - each element of a compund structre is expressed
 * Compact - complex structures are represented as strings (or arrays of strings)
